---
title: "Contributing to CaML"
---

Welcome to the CaML contributor guide!

We manage out project via [Github](https://github.com/jakepenzak/caml) and
leverage [Github Flow](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/using-github/github-flow)
for managing our development process. This guide will help you get started as a contributor
and guide you through the process of contributing to CaML.

## General Contribution Guide

Pull requests are the best way to make changes to CaML:

1. Fork the repo amd create your branch from `main` branch
2. Clone the repository locally
3. For environment setup, see [Environment Setup](environment.qmd)
4. For documentation, see [Documentation](documentation.qmd)
5. For testing, see [Testing](testing.qmd)
6. Try best to follow commit message conventions outlined [here](https://gist.github.com/qoomon/4dfcdf8eec66a051ecd85625518cfd13)
6. Create a pull request & fill out the generated PR template

All github actions & checks will be required to complete successfully prior to merging.

## Report Bugs using Github Issues

Bugs, features, and any other feedback can be submitted using the Github [issues page](https://github.com/jakepenzak/caml/issues).
